abstract: The greenways identification process leaves an important place to the use of knowledge. Ecological but also territorial dimensions should be linked up along with different types of knowledge – scientific, managerial or local. Through the case study of a modeling work ordered by a Parc Naturel Regional to a research consultancy we analyzed how the chosen methods keep local sources of information away. Overall we consider the place given to the quantitative data in a world obsessed by performance and transparency. This paper outlines ways to favor discussions and to take into consideration knowledge diversity.
